page.title: 11Shepshed Parish Church
page.content: {St.Botolph's}parish church stands on a hill above{Shepshed.}It has been the focal point of the village since the {11th century}and today still plays an important role. It is built of local {Charnwood}stone as are many houses.In the high banked cemetery,where graves lay one on another,is a unique tombstone.It commemorates the death of one George Dakin either in January 1751 or 1752.The confusion was due to the changing of the calendar at the start of the year.Many of the church plaques are dedicated to the Phillipps family who owned the Lordships of {Garendon.}Their "lease of the Shepshed parsonage" ended when their allegiance changed to the Catholic church and their names changed to{de {Lisle.
